column7: Description
Accused of rape in an incident that happened in 2013 when Gotsis was a student at Georgia Tech.
Pulled over for speeding, cops found marijuana in the car.
Accused of harassment and non-physical domestic violence in incident involving his former girlfriend.
Latimer called police and alleged his girlfriend hit him. Police found outstanding traffic warrant from 2015 and arrested him for that.
Accused of drunken driving in Ada County, Idaho.
column8: Pleaded guilty to misdemeanor, one year probation, community service, fined nearly $1,000.

column7: Accused of being drunk, head-butting and hitting a cab driver and trying to hide from police by stealing a shovel and covering himself in mulch.
column8: Resolution undetermined. Team cut him the next day.

column7: Accused of throwing a glass at a female bartender after being told he couldn't buy at the strip club.
column8: Diversion program, four hours community service.

column7: Pulled over for speeding in Arapahoe County, Colo., accused of driving with a suspended license. Second traffic issue in six weeks.
column8: Pleaded guilty to traffic offenses, required to take driving class and do 24 hours of community service.

column7: Pulled over for speeding, charged with failing to appear in court for previous traffic ticket from Jan. 25, 2013.
column8: Pleaded guilty to having a defective vehicle, adding two points to license.

column7: Arrested near Denver on warrant for failure to appear in court on previous traffic charges, including careless driving and driving without a license.
Pulled over after 2 a.m., accused of drunken driving and lane violation in Arapahoe County, Colo.

Accused of aggravated assault with a firearm in Miami after allegedly lifting his shirt to show a gun to a motorist.
Charged with drunken driving after being pulled over for speeding. License plate reportedly was "SAUCED."
column8: Pleaded guilty to driving while impaired, 30-day suspended jail sentence, 24 hours community service.

column7: Accused of felony stalking, ordered to cease contact with victim.
Accused of drunk driving after allegedly backing his Chevy Trailblazer into parked car and fleeing the scene.
Pulled over in St. Louis, accused of unlawful possession of guns and drugs with other men.
Girlfriend accused him of shoving and striking her in the face. Charged with battery and assault.
column8: Charges dropped for a lack of evidence. Alexander cut by Broncos a day after arrest.

column7: Accused of impregnanting woman after she passed out at his home.
Pulled over on suspicion on drunk driving in Denver at 2:40 a.m. Also cited for driving without headlights.
column8: Convicted of DUI and sentenced to 30 days home arrest.

column7: Cited for assault, disturbing the peace after alleged altercation with parking lot attendant at Invesco Field after he forgot his credentials.
column8: Charges dimissed five days before scheduled trial.

column7: Pulled over in Houston upon witness seeing Fields waving a gun at a club, then driving off, charged with misdemeanor.

Accused of disorderly conduct in Atlanta after fight with fiance.
Accused of hitting his girlfriend on March 4, misdemeanor battery.
column8: Acquitted. NFL suspended him one game.

column7: Pulled over in Florida, accused of cocaine possession after police said the found the drug and gun in truck.
Arrest warrant issued stemming from driving without valid license in Florida and not appearing in court afterward.
Accused of drunken driving in Orlando, Fla., refusing breath test.
column8: Pleaded no contest to refusing to submit to test, 50 hours of community service, license suspended for six months.

column7: Suspected of harrasing former girlfriend, who told law enforcement he struck a bedpost during argument about sale of home.

column8: Pleaded guilty to reduced charges, two years of probation.

column7: Police in Utah accused him of marijuana possession after pulling him over for running a stop sign and then smelling it in his car.

column8: Pleaded guilty to misdemeanor, sentenced to supervised probation. Team released him shortly after the incident.

column7: Pulled over in Preble County, Ohio, for traffic violation, accused of marijuana possession.

column7: Accused of hitting a pizza delivery driver in the head in a dispute over a parking space in Washington, D.C.

column8: Pleaded guilty, 14 days of home confinement, fines and $1,000 in court costs, alcohol treatment program.

column7: Accused of rape, battery and criminal confinement of woman who said he attacked her Dec. 1 after night of drinking.
column8: Acquitted by jury and rejoined the team.

column7: Pulled over for swerving in Indianapolis, suspected of drunken driving.
column8: Resolution undetermined. Team cut him later that day.

column7: Accused of drunk driving and speeding in Muncie, Ind.

column8: Resolution undetermined. Team cut him the next day.

Accused of misdemeanor marijuana possession in Florida.

column7: Pulled over at 2:31 a.m. for speeding and cited with suspicion of driving under the influence. Blood-alcohol measured .10.
column8: Convicted of misdemeanor operating a vehicle while intoxicated with a blood-alcohol count of .08 to .15 and public intoxication. Sentenced to 180 days probation.

column7: Cited after found in a ditch on the side of the road, barefoot and slurring his speech.
column8: Charged dropped. Gill entered treatment facility.

column8: Resolution undetermined. Cut by team within a day of arrest.

column7: Accused of refusing to leave nightclub parking lot being cleared by police, trespassing, public intoxication, disorderly conduct.

column7: Pulled over for speeding in Alabama, accused of marijuana possession after police dog searched car.

column8: Pleaded no contest to trespassing, with ajudication withheld. Disorderly conduct charge dropped. Paid $265 in court costs.

Accused of pulling loaded gun a man in dispute in Addison, Texas, also having outstanding traffic warrants.

Suspected of violating protective order in Nashville stemming from domestic incident.

column8: Pleaded guilty to misdemeanor battery, required to take anger management classses.

column7: Pulled over around 2:30 a.m. in San Diego, suspected of drunken driving.

column8: Pleaded guilty to possession of controlled substance, charged later dropped through diversion program.

column7: Pulled over for playing loud music, cited for driving with a suspended license and expired tags.

column7: Accused of battery and false imprisonment after allegedly choking and restraining his girlfriend, television personality Tila Tequila, in San Diego.
column8: Charges dismissed less than a week later.

column7: Cited for misdemeanor battery after a security guard at a San Diego hotel said Phillips punched him.
column8: Never charged. Civil settlement with guard.

column7: Pulled over for speeding, accused of drunken driving but blood-alcohol content measured at under the legal limit of .08.
column8: Pleaded guilty to a lane-change violation and speeding, required to take traffic safety class.

column7: Pulled over for speeding and weaving, failed sobriety tests in San Diego, accused of drunken driving in 2008 GMC Sierra.
column8: Sentenced to four days in jail and five years of probation

column7: Cited for allegedly pushing and kicking an Uber driver in the early morning hours of April 14 following a dispute over the fare, according to the police report. The report states Oher had been drinking.
Accused of driving 102 mph in a 65-mph zone in North Carolina.
Pulled over for seatbelt violation, cited for possession of drug paraphernalia after officer smelled marijuana.
column8: Pleaded guilty to misdemeanor, 48 hours community service, one year of probation.

column8: Case dismissed on appeal after being convicted by judge on assault charge, 18 months probation. Deactivated by team.

column7: Pulled over for speeding, accused of having 11 grams of marijuana.

column8: Resolution undetermined. Cut by team same day of arrest.

column7: Accused of aggravated assault after a confrontation with a man in Charlotte strip club.
Accused of spraying champagne on restaurant patrons and making threats in Charlotte.
Accused of driving while impaired just hours before team made its final cuts.
column8: Pleaded guilty to driving while impaired, 30-day suspended sentence. Released by team within a day.

column7: Police say he ran a red light and crossed center line, accused of drunken driving with blood-alcohol content of 0.12 near Charlotte.
column8: Pleaded guilty, surrended license, 24 hours of community service, $420 in court costs.

column7: University of Texas Officers responded to a report of the smell of marijuana coming from three occupied vehicles on campus just after midnight. Officers discovered marijuana in each vehicle and also discovered a firearm registered to Foreman.
